abstract.text: Our product is NP, and we need to be able to answer questions about it.

inlineContent.text: The eight academic schools in Ngee Ann Polytechnic are, with their most popular course:
Common entry programmes (CEPs) are for students who
✅ sure of which industry they want to go into
After Y1S2, they choose which course to take. ALL Y1 STUDENTS IN EACH SCHOOL TAKE THE SAME MODULES.
Exception being LSCT, where only 2 diplomas are available for CEP
Time and space to explore interests + deeper skills
Learn foundational modules, taster of each course
Clear & better informed about diploma courses
PLUS: “Second chance” into preferred course if was highly competitive and did not make it first try
Carousell is made by NP alumni!
for places around NP worth talking about.
Personalised Learning Pathway is basically just getting a minor.
Basically flexible learning. You decide what/how/where you want to learn.
Match your own interests and aspirations to what you learn.
There are 8 ways to Go Flex your learning:
Only for design science, elec engi, elec comp engi, information tech, mechatronics & robotics
It’s new so only some courses
Entrepreneurship-focused learning, mentorship from NP and industry profs
See each course for details on their specialisations
Only for BME, CSF, DS, DES, ES, HLFM, IT
Teammates from different fields of study
Mainly for those who want to start their career straight after poly, instead of going to uni
Note: You are not guarenteed any of these
“NP is the Poly for Budding Entrepreneurs!” ~ what you should say
There are many initiatives open to ALL students, regardless of course, to provide support &
Global Entrepreneurship Internship Programme (GEIP): Internships at overseas startups, SEA cities
Kickstart fund: $5K to fund students’ business projects
Be Your Own Boss (BYOB) competition: Annual F&B competition, $5K given to winner to start cafe on campus. NP
exclusive! eg. mac and cheese store
Makers Academy: Build product prototypes FOR FREE

inlineContent.text: It is NOT more difficult to enter! You just need to
, and your choice of JC/Poly shd
depend on what style of learning you prefer (projects vs academics).
of NP students persue further studies in universities.
Best way to choose your 12 choices:
4x Passion: What you want to do (cutoff irrelevant)
4x Practical: What you could feasibly do (ELR2B2 near past cutoff)
4x Prudent: What you definetely can do (ELR2B2 well below past cutoff)
We don’t focus on this very much. Tell them to google it or smth
When you compare between NP and another poly or JCs in general, try to
DO NOT put down the other institution
DO NOT try and speak for JCs, esp when comparing
about something, do NOT say something wrong. This will
dig yourself into a hole that will be difficult to get out of, or you may give
tell them to check the NP website
refer to somebody else that knows
If a student comes up to you with really vague questions, try probing more before
suggesting a diploma. Remember that CEPs are for when THEY don’t know what THEY want,
not when YOU don’t know what THEY want.
Always mention that “it us up to you”
No stand-offish posture, eg. crossing arms
When promoting something, start general (eg. how it benefits all NP students), then
“zoom in” (eg. how a specific course uses it), so you dont lose interest
If marks are VERY offensive, direct talk to seniors/teachers
Eat/drink (water is fine, face away from visitors)
